Repository-set of files for a given project that you will track
Commit- a snapshot of the reposityr made at a certain time with a message
Clone- makinga copy of a repsoity to another machine
Remote- a place to store the master copy of the repository on the internet (e.g. GitHub)
Branch- an independent copy of the repository. Often you will try out changes on a develper branch before mvoing them to the master copy
Fork- enough like branch to be fine with no distinction
Push- moving commits to the remote copy
Pull- getting commits from the remote copy
Merge- moving changes from one branch to the master copy
Testtesttest
